intro: Licania arianeae, commonly known as the Brazilian arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, smooth seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical environments with rich, well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and research settings.
